instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115B: What is 820-3115B? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> bios with clean me
threads.message:
Hi I purchased  a board off eBay and I repaired the water damaged areas. but it has no bios chip I’d like to do a clean ME and switch serial# from a donor chip.  I searched on this forum but all the “clean” or “test” bios say “in owners trash” or just don’t download. I wanted to use ME injector to just change the ME region first and fix serial # later.
with a donor bios fans spins but that’s about it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> bios with clean me
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> bios with clean me
threads.message: Thank you very much. Do you happen to have one for <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>? That’s all I will need. If possible that would be great

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> bios with clean me
threads.message: Unfortunately that didn’t work :( it also does nothing. But I removed the bios from the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board awaiting pch and that bios chimes on this board but has no video :( so I guess I’ll just keep looking for another bios thank you 2informatico

threads.message:

Write it on other chip...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> bios with clean me
threads.message: How long should it take for the “ME” to finish its process of getting “reacquainted” with hardware? I waited like 2 mins is this enough For the machine to boot? Sometimes I notice longer wait times than others

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> bios with clean me
threads.message:
